Text: Does it work? Any bugs? System Reqirements? Recomended settings? DL speed? I know you're a trusted uploader Noobish but could you post some information here?
does it work?

Does it work with GMA950?
probably not :(

Port Info:
CXZ Aquamarine Engine you need

System Requirements:
- OS: Mac OS X 10.5 Leopard (maybe) / Mac OS X 10.6 Snow Leopard (for sure)
- CPU: Intel Core 2 Duo Processor
- RAM: 1024 MB
- Video: 256 MB
- installing X11
- about 8.3 GB Hard Drive Space required
Don't think this will run well on GMA chips, but you're free to try!

3. Known Issues:
- no mouse in menu, just use your arrow keys to navigate it.
- holographic eye candy doesn't exist
- in space the planet misses
- mouse might be a bit sluggish at times

GREETZ
There is no way to save your game since you can't move the mouse in menus, I don't feel like keeping the game open 24/7, please find a fix to this...

I recommand Play on BootCamp for best performance / compatibility !

The game works in OS X 10.6.3 and above. Won't work properly on older OS X versions - severe graphics bugs (missing walls and other objects). Tested and confirmed by many users on other trackers.

Known issues:
- no mouse in menu
- 'ghost' cursor
- missing EA logo on the first screen, missing menus and messages frames, missing pictures on the level loading screens
- spaceship virtual control panels and virtual space maps are invisible
- the first scene (crash) is rendered with errors - the planet in the outer space on the left on the screen is missing and most other objects in the outer space too (see the beginning of the game trailer (in the EXTRAS folder) for proper picture) and the lighting is invalid
...
Yeah the language is Russian... can't navigate shit, or understand dialogue. Really annoying- makes me not want to play the game... can someone help?
Ok got it- you have to open the readme, install a seperate engine to help with gameplay, and change a text file that controls settings. The readme lays it out perfectly. Thanks thenoobish
